mta.ads.smid.model
Class IUFkForest

java.lang.Object
  mta.ads.smid.patterns.Observable<IUFkEvent>
      mta.ads.smid.model.IUFkForest

public class IUFkForest
extends Observable<IUFkEvent>

A Data Structure Implementation for Union Find Problem, Having a Good Single-Operation Complexity.
Based on the Michel H.M. Smid Document.

Author:
Yossi Naor & Yosi Zilberberg

 int find(int name)
          Find the root name for a given leaf name

IUFkForest

public IUFkForest(int k,
                  int n)
Parameters:
k - The degree for each tree (k-tree)
n - The number of managed elements on the data structure (0,1,...,n-1)
Method Detail

verifyNameInRange

private void verifyNameInRange(int name)
                        throws IUFkForestException.NameOutOfRangeException
Verifies that a given element name is in the correct range
The range is between 0 and (n-1). In case of an error throws NameOutOfRangeException exception.

Parameters:
name -
Throws:
IUFkForestException.NameOutOfRangeException

unionCase1

private NodeManager.Root unionCase1(int intoLeaf,
                                    int fromLeaf,
                                    NodeManager.Root into,
                                    NodeManager.Root from)
                             throws IUFkForestException
Union Case 1: union two trees, that their root have the same height and their number of sons <=k
perform the following:
  • link sons from source tree to the root in the destination tree, disposing the source Root element
  • link the root of the destination tree into the sons of the source tree
  • notify listeners for performing a union
  • write statistics

Parameters:
intoLeaf - a given leaf name in the destination tree
fromLeaf - a given leaf name in the source tree
into - the Root element of the destination tree
from - the Root element of the source tree
Returns:
the Root element of the destination tree
Throws:
IUFkForestException

unionCase2

private NodeManager.Root unionCase2(int leaf1,
                                    int leaf2,
                                    NodeManager.Root root1,
                                    NodeManager.Root root2)
                             throws IUFkForestException
Union Case 2: union two trees (two roots), that their root have the same height and their number of sons > k
perform the following:
  • create a new Root element
    • add the two trees as sons of the new root, converting them into NonRoot nodes
    • link the two trees (NonRoot nodes) into the new root
  • notify listeners for performing a union
  • write statistics

Parameters:
leaf1 - a given leaf name in the first tree
leaf2 - a given leaf name in the second tree
root1 - the Root element of the first tree
root2 - the Root element of the second tree
Returns:
the new Root element
Throws:
IUFkForestException

unionCase3

private NodeManager.Root unionCase3(int intoFirstSonLeaf,
                                    int fromLeaf,
                                    NodeManager.Root intoFirstSon,
                                    NodeManager.Root from)
                             throws IUFkForestException
Union Case 3: union two trees, in which the destination tree height is higher than the source tree.
perform the following:
  • link sons from source tree to the first son of the root in the destination tree, disposing the source root element
  • notify listeners for performing a union
  • write statistics

Parameters:
intoFirstSonLeaf - a given leaf name in the destination tree
fromLeaf - a given leaf name in the source tree
intoFirstSon - the Root element of the source tree
from - the Root element of the destination tree
Returns:
the Root element of the destination tree
Throws:
IUFkForestException

union

private NodeManager.Root union(int leafR,
                               int leafS,
                               NodeManager.Root r,
                               NodeManager.Root s)
                        throws IUFkForestException
Performs a union by Root elements.
The Root elements have already been searched before invoking this method.
According to the properties of s and r root elements we invoke the correct case (1-3).
highlights for each case:
  • case 1: the root with the least sons is the source root
  • case 2: the 'name' of the new root will be set according to the root with most sons

Parameters:
leafR - leaf name in tree R
leafS - leaf name in tree S
r - Root element of tree R
s - Root element of tree S
Returns:
the new Root element (could be s,r to a new Root element)
Throws:
IUFkForestException

find

private NodeManager.Root find(NodeManager.NonRoot nonRoot)
Search for the Root element of a given NonRoot by climbing up the tree

Parameters:
nonRoot - a NonRoot element
Returns:
the Root element

union

public void union(int r,
                  int s)
           throws IUFkForestException
Union two leaves (in two different trees)
implementation highlights:
  • verify that r,s names are in range
  • efficiently find Root elements for s,r
  • if s,r already have the same Root element we do nothing, otherwise invoke the private union method

Parameters:
r - leaf name in tree R (there might be a corresponding Root element matching that name)
s - leaf name in tree S (there might be a corresponding Root element matching that name)
Throws:
IUFkForestException

find

public int find(int name)
         throws IUFkForestException
Find the root name for a given leaf name
implementation highlights:
  • check if there is a corresponding Root element matching the given name and return it (if exists) - O(1)
  • otherwise, perform find recursively by invoking private find method - O(log/k(n))
  • add statistics (for reach case)

Parameters:
name - a given leaf name (there might be a corresponding Root element matching that name)
Returns:
root name
Throws:
IUFkForestException

getStatistics

public Statistics getStatistics()
Returns:
statistics

getK

public int getK()
Returns:
k (the size of k-tree)

getN

public int getN()
Returns:
n (the number of managed elements)
